required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Wear-Time Trial for Self-Fitting Hearing Aid
clinical_study.official_title: Protocol for Self-Fitting Hearing Aid Wear-Time Trial for Listeners With Mild to Moderate Hearing Loss

brief_summary.textblock: This document describes a clinical validation study for a double-blind repeated-measures comparative study of the GN self-fitting method to a validated audiology-best-practices method when fitting the GN Self-fitting Hearing Aid, a device intended for persons aged 18-75 years old who have mild-to-moderate hearing loss. A crossover wear-time field trial will be conducted. The focus of the study is on the validity of the self-fitting process used to select appropriate frequency-gain characteristics for the GN Self-fitting Hearing Aid, and the safety and effectiveness of the device.

primary_outcome.measure: Abbreviated Profile of Hearing Aid Benefit (APHAB)
primary_outcome.description: A 24-item survey of hearing aid benefit with 7 possible responses for each item

secondary_outcome.description: An adaptive measure of sentence recognition in competing speech with 6 sentences (30 keywords) scored as correct or incorrect

arm_group.description: Hearing aids fit by a professional hearing care provider using best practices.

intervention.description: Earbud style hearing aids fit to both ears

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Mild-to-moderate bilateral sensorineural hearing loss (thresholds from 250 - 8000 Hz less than 60 dB HL and from 2000 - 8000 Hz, at least one threshold greater than 20 dB HL)
- Mix of male and female subjects (aiming for a representative balance)
- Mix of prior hearing-aid use (aiming for 70-80% persons with no prior hearing aid use)
- 18-75 years old (aiming for primarily 50-70 years old, with avg. age ~65 years)
- Apple iPhone (iOS 14 compatible or greater, as required for the SELF-FIT app)
- Able to read and comprehend English
- Patient willing to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hearing outside of limits noted above
- Self-reported ear-related pathology (including chronic severe dizziness or chronic severe tinnitus)

reference.citation: Cox RM, Alexander GC. The abbreviated profile of hearing aid benefit. Ear Hear. 1995 Apr;16(2):176-86.

Killion MC, Niquette PA, Gudmundsen GI, Revit LJ, Banerjee S. Development of a quick speech-in-noise test for measuring signal-to-noise ratio loss in normal-hearing and hearing-impaired listeners. J Acoust Soc Am. 2004 Oct;116(4 Pt 1):2395-405. Erratum in: J Acoust Soc Am. 2006 Mar;119(3):1888.
